channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Books We Love is back. Here are some highlights. And, what to expect on Black Friday
item.description: NPR staffers bring you more than 300 new book recommendations in the latest edition of Books We Love. Plus, what to expect from a record-breaking holiday spending season.
item.content:encoded: NPR staffers bring you more than 300 new book recommendations in the latest edition of Books We Love. Plus, what to expect from a record-breaking holiday spending season.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: O Christmas tree, O Christmas tree, which is more sustainable: real or plasticky?
item.description: It's time to discuss one of the perennial debates of the holiday season. Are real Christmas trees or their fake counterparts more eco-friendly?
item.content:encoded:
It's time to discuss one of the perennial debates of the holiday season. Are real Christmas trees or their fake counterparts more eco-friendly?

(Image credit: Johannes Eisele)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: How do you re-create the voice of a 15th century king? Dig up his skeleton
item.description: When Richard III's skeleton was found under a parking lot in England in 2012, it was an exciting enough discovery for the general public, but a game-changer for Yvonne Morley-Chisholm.
item.content:encoded:
When Richard III's skeleton was found under a parking lot in England in 2012, it was an exciting enough discovery for the general public, but a game-changer for Yvonne Morley-Chisholm.

(Image credit: Face Lab at Liverpool John Moores University and the Voice for Richard team)
item.dc:creator: Kathryn Fink

item.title: Ireland votes in a close-run election where incumbents hope to cling on to power
item.description: The parliamentary election will decide the next government, and will show whether Ireland bucks the global trend of incumbents being ousted by disgruntled voters.
item.content:encoded:
The parliamentary election will decide the next government, and will show whether Ireland bucks the global trend of incumbents being ousted by disgruntled voters.

(Image credit: Niall Carson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 2 pediatricians answer your questions about traveling with kids over the holidays
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with pediatricians Candice Jones and Jaime Friedman, who offer tips on how to travel with little ones. (Story aired on Morning Edition on Nov. 24, 2024.)
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with pediatricians Candice Jones and Jaime Friedman, who offer tips on how to travel with little ones. (Story aired on Morning Edition on Nov. 24, 2024.)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: The 2024 Atlantic hurricane season was the deadliest in nearly two decades
item.description: The six-month season saw an above-average number of storms. Scientists say climate change is leading to more powerful and deadly hurricanes that can affect inland communities far from the coasts.
item.content:encoded:
The six-month season saw an above-average number of storms. Scientists say climate change is leading to more powerful and deadly hurricanes that can affect inland communities far from the coasts.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Venezuela's opposition leader says Maduro is 'weaker than ever'
item.description: From hiding, María Corina Machado says she'll continue to fight for Venezuelan democracy.
item.content:encoded:
From hiding, María Corina Machado says she'll continue to fight for Venezuelan democracy.

(Image credit: Juan Barreto)
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Disappointed by this year's climate talks, Indigenous advocates look to Brazil in 2025
item.description: Indigenous advocates called the final agreement in Azerbaijan "drastically insufficient." Now they're focusing on next year's global climate summit in Brazil where Indigenous participation is expected to be historic.
item.content:encoded:
Indigenous advocates called the final agreement in Azerbaijan "drastically insufficient." Now they're focusing on next year's global climate summit in Brazil where Indigenous participation is expected to be historic.

(Image credit: Dominika Zarzycka/SOPA Images)
item.dc:creator: Nate Perez

item.title: Who Invented Indian Butter Chicken? (Encore)
item.description:
In an episode we first brought you in March, we consider butter chicken. It is a much-loved Indian dish, both within that country and around the world. But who can claim they invented it? That question is the subject of a lawsuit. Our reporter tries to get to the bottom of butter chicken's origin and finds out that it is a journey through India's history.

You can find celebrated Indian chef Madhur Jaffrey's recipe for butter chicken here.
item.content:encoded:
In an episode we first brought you in March, we consider butter chicken. It is a much-loved Indian dish, both within that country and around the world. But who can claim they invented it? That question is the subject of a lawsuit. Our reporter tries to get to the bottom of butter chicken's origin and finds out that it is a journey through India's history.

You can find celebrated Indian chef Madhur Jaffrey's recipe for butter chicken here.

(Image credit: Arun Sankar)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Democratic lawmakers report Thanksgiving bomb threats against their homes
item.description: At least five Democratic members of Congress from Connecticut were targeted by bomb threats on Thursday. Police who responded said they found no evidence of explosives on the lawmakers' properties.
item.content:encoded:
At least five Democratic members of Congress from Connecticut were targeted by bomb threats on Thursday. Police who responded said they found no evidence of explosives on the lawmakers' properties.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
